# Ablative Barrier (Spell)

[[Conjuration Spells|Conjuration]] ([[Creation Spells|creation]]) \[[[Force Spells|force]]]
**Level:** [[2nd Level Alchemist Spells|Alchemist 2]], [[2nd Level Bloodrager Spells|Bloodrager 2]], [[2nd Level Magus Spells|Magus 2]], [[2nd Level Occultist Spells|Occultist 2]], [[3rd Level Psychic Spells|Psychic 3]], [[3rd Level Sorcerer Spells|Sorcerer 3]], [[2nd Level Summoner Spells|Summoner 2]], Unchained [[3rd Level Summoner Spells|summoner 3]], [[3rd Level Wizard Spells|Wizard 3]]
**BoXM:** [[BoXM 5th-Level Wizard Spells List|Wizard 5]]
**Casting Time:** 1 standard action
**Components:** V, S, M (a piece of metal cut from a shield)
**Range:** Touch
**Target:** Creature touched
**Duration:** 1 hour/level or until discharged
**Saving Throw:** Will negates (harmless)
**Spell Resistance:** No
**Source:** Ultimate Combat, pg. 221

Invisible layers of solid force surround and protect the target, granting that target a +2 armor bonus to AC. Additionally, the first 5 points of lethal damage the target takes from each attack are converted into nonlethal damage. Against attacks that already deal nonlethal damage, the target gains DR 5/—. Once this spell has converted 5 points of damage to nonlethal damage per caster level (maximum 50 points), the spell is discharged.
#Spell-Resistance/No #Sources/Ultimate-Combat #Spell-Level/Alchemist-2 #Spell-School/Conjuration #Spell-Subschool/Creation #Spell-Descriptor/Force #Spell-Level/Magus-2 #Spell-Level/Sorcerer-Wizard-3 #Spell-Level/Summoner-2 #Spell-Range/Touch #Saving-Throws/Will-Negates

**Mythic Rule**

Add half your tier to the spell’s armor bonus. Add half your tier to the amount of lethal damage from each attack that is converted to nonlethal damage and to the DR against nonlethal damage. Add half your tier to your caster level when determining how much damage the spell converts before it’s discharged.

**Source:** Pathfinder RPG Ultimate Combat, pg.

**GM Note**

*House Rule:* Added Bloodrager 2, Occultist 2, Psychic 3, Unchained summoner 3 to Level.
